sections.title: Slayer (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Slayer class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Slayer)
sections.description: Slayers are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

sections.title: Studied Target (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: As a move action, the slayer can study a visible opponent to gain bonuses on skill checks, attack rolls, damage rolls, and ability DCs against that target.

sections.title: Track (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: The slayer adds half his level (minimum 1) to Survival checks made to follow tracks.

sections.title: Slayer Talents (Slayer)
sections.description: Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the slayer gains talents that enhance his abilities, with some marked with asterisks affecting sneak attack.

sections.title: Sneak Attack (Slayer)
sections.description: Starting at 3rd level, the slayer deals extra 1d6 damage (increasing every 3 levels) when attacking targets denied Dex bonus to AC or when flanking.

sections.title: Stalker (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 7th level, the slayer gains his studied target bonus on Disguise, Intimidate, and Stealth checks against his studied opponent.

sections.title: Advanced Talents (Slayer)
sections.description: Starting at 10th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the slayer can select advanced talents in place of regular slayer talents.

sections.title: Swift Tracker (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 11th level, the slayer can track at normal speed without penalty, and at double speed with only -10 penalty instead of -20.

sections.title: Slayer’s Advance (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 13th level, the slayer can move up to twice his base speed as a move action once per day (twice per day at 17th level), with optional Stealth at -10 penalty.

sections.title: Quarry (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 14th level, the slayer can designate a studied target as his quarry, gaining tracking benefits, +2 insight bonus on attacks, and automatic critical threat confirmation.

sections.title: Improved Quarry (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 19th level, quarry selection becomes a free action, allows taking 20 on tracking, increases insight bonus to +4, and reduces new quarry delay to 10 minutes.

sections.title: Master Slayer (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 20th level, the slayer can make a standard action attack against a studied target to potentially kill, knock unconscious, or paralyze with a failed Fortitude save.

sections.title: Against the Odds (Ex) (Slayer)
sections.description: At 20th level, when using studied target, the slayer can study up to two additional foes with the same action.
